column5: Hi all,  Got out on Lac Seul yesterday. We were at Williams Bay which i guess is the central part of the Lake.  One fish...the first one (a nice 24") came out of 20'FOW just in front of a midwater reef, the rest all came from 14' to 8' FOW. I did head out to where the channel meets the main lake....but there was a noticible drop in water temperature(surface) as soon as you got to water facing the main basin....we had 63 degrees just prior to getting to the main basin right down to 54 degrees in a matter of seconds. There were fish on the screen in the open water (deep too) but nothing biting.  So most of our day was spent in one large bay searching the 14' to 8' depths. We caught around 20 fish each....lots of small ones with the best one a respectable 25".  Although i've caught more fish before...the amount of slot and over slot fish was better, i think i got around 10 fish in slot and above....probably more than i got all last year!!!!  Green/chartreuse the jig colour, minnows were bait. All the big fish were on 4" sucker and dace minnows, Garnet (my fishing buddy for the day) was using the small minnows, he's not used to using anything else and stuck with what he felt comfortable with...but the difference was clear as he only got one slot fish on the smaller baits.  I did keep one over slot fish (22") and when cleaning it last night expected to find large bait fish inside given what they were scarfing down from my hook, but there was only fish fly larvae....stuffed to the gills.  Another thing i noticed was the areas we found that held fish were being battered by the wind and definitely rocky to mud transitions....whether that be a reef to mud...or where a rocky/boulder shore area turned to sand or mud...even if it was just a small offshore boulder pile.   Anyway...here's some pics and vid. BE WARNED....A FEW 'F' BOMBS IN THE LAST FEW SECONDS OF THE VIDEO    <iframe width="560" height="349" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/uhNS0W4jA5I" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
Excellent Simon, really great fish there and the water looks calm and beautiful.  Great report  Lac Seul is on my to-do list!!!
awesome walleye report & pics !!! some very nice sized eyes....cheers
You're livin the life Simon... don't stop !
Woot Woot! Lac Seul is an awesome fishery!  Looks like some good times Limey!!!
Awesome stuff, man...love those big healthy 'eyes!!  That last sunset shot has me thinking it's time for another one of your music videos
woooo awesome as always.... great view and nice walleye.... great stuff simon...
Great report! Congrats on the 'eyes. Thanks for sharing the tackle and location details!!

The weather was stunning Joey, the fishing average...and the company great, good day all in all.  When are you guys gonna head North?    Thanks FD...cant wait till mid July when the big girls go deep.    Thanks Wayne....i always stop for a few seconds while i'm out to make a mental note of how lucky i am so i dont ever take it for granted.    Dood...i had to do something to catch you up!!!    lol pick a tune JB...i'll see what i can come up with    Thanks Bfisher    Thanks Homer, i am trying to add more detail to my reports....it helps me too as a record to look back at.
Its a "one of these days" trips Simon, but when it happens, I'll be in touch for sure
Great report Simon and some great looking Walleye! I will be going for my first fishing excursion of the year next week and you have me salivating!
Good stuff Simon, some nice fat walleye for you.  I hear  ya about the mayfly nymphs, most of the walleye I've harvested in the last 10 days are loaded with them.

Great report and awesome photos  planning a two week trip this summer , with one week on LOW with son #1 guideing  and defineatly a day or two on Lac Seul (gotta find that sandbar again!) , then Eagle lake , then Nipigon , then Superior  , ...maybe 3 weeks  TB
